meanings.definition: A mythical period of time in Australian Aboriginal culture when the world was created.
meanings.sent1: During the dreamtimes, the ancestors roamed the earth and shaped the land.
meanings.sent2: She often gets lost in her own dreamtimes, imagining magical worlds and creatures.
meanings.sent3: In her dreamtimes, she believes she can fly and talk to animals.
meanings.sent4: The dreamtimes of the past hold the secrets of our origins and existence.
meanings.sent5: The dreamtimes are like a painting where every stroke tells a story of creation.

meanings.definition: A time of dreaming or daydreaming.
meanings.sent1: His mind wandered into the dreamtimes, where he built castles in the sky.
meanings.sent2: During class, she often slips into her own dreamtimes, oblivious to the lesson.
meanings.sent3: In her dreamtimes, she becomes a famous singer performing for a crowd of animals.
meanings.sent4: The dreamtimes of his imagination are filled with endless possibilities and adventures.
meanings.sent5: The dreamtimes feel like a cozy blanket wrapping her in a world of fantasies.
